SEARCH
Package com.w10.risk_game.models

Class Player

java.lang.Object
com.w10.risk_game.models.Player
public class Player extends Object
The Player class represents a player in this game, with properties such as name, countries owned, orders, and leftover armies, as well as methods to manipulate these properties.
Author:
Darlene-Naz, Omnia Alam

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player(String p_name, List<Country> p_countriesOwned, List<Order> p_orders, int p_leftoverArmies)
      The `Player` constructor is initializing a new instance of the `Player` class with the provided parameters. It sets the player's name (`d_name`), the list of countries owned by the player (`d_countriesOwned`), the list of orders for the player (`d_orders`), and the number of leftover armies of the player (`d_leftoverArmies`).
      Parameters:
      p_name - the player name
      p_countriesOwned - the list of countries owned by the player
      p_orders - the list of orders to issue
      p_leftoverArmies - the number of current army in possess by the player

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      The function returns the name of the player.
      Returns:
      The method is returning the player's name.

    • setName

      public void setName(String p_name)
      The function sets the name of the player.
      Parameters:
      p_name - The parameter "p_name" is a String that represents the name of the player.

    • getCountriesOwned

      public List<Country> getCountriesOwned()
      The getCountriesOwned function returns a list of countries owned by the player.
      Returns:
      A List of Country objects is being returned.

    • setCountriesOwned

      public void setCountriesOwned(List<Country> p_countriesOwned)
      The function sets the list of countries owned by a player.
      Parameters:
      p_countriesOwned - This parameter is a List of objects of type Country. It represents the countries that are owned by a player.

    • getOrders

      public List<Order> getOrders()
      The function returns the player's list of orders.
      Returns:
      A List of Order objects is being returned.

    • hasCountry

      public boolean hasCountry(int p_CountryId)
      The function checks if a given country ID exists in a list of owned countries.
      Parameters:
      p_CountryId - An integer representing the ID of a country.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value.

    • setOrders

      public void setOrders(List<Order> p_orders)
      The function sets the list of orders for a given player.
      Parameters:
      p_orders - The parameter "p_orders" is a List of Order of a player.

    • getLeftoverArmies

      public int getLeftoverArmies()
      The function returns the number of leftover armies.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value, specifically the value of the variable "d_leftoverArmies".

    • setLeftoverArmies

      public void setLeftoverArmies(int p_leftoverArmies)
      The function sets the value of the "leftoverArmies" variable.
      Parameters:
      p_leftoverArmies - The parameter "p_leftoverArmies" is an integer that represents the number of leftover armies.

    • deployArmies

      public void deployArmies(int p_num)
      The function "deployArmies" subtracts the specified number of armies from the leftover armies.
      Parameters:
      p_num - The parameter "p_num" represents the number of armies that are being deployed.

    • addArmies

      public void addArmies(int p_num)
      The function adds a specified number of armies to a player's leftoverArmies.
      Parameters:
      p_num - The parameter "p_num" represents the number of armies that will be added to the existing number of leftover armies.

    • issueOrder

      public void issueOrder()
      This method is used to issue an order This method gets the command input, creates an order object and adds it to the list of orders

    • nextOrder

      public Order nextOrder()
      The function "nextOrder" returns and removes the first element from a list of player's orders.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an object of type Order.

    • checkValidForm

      public boolean checkValidForm(String[] p_inputArray)
      This function is used to check the input format. The input should have three parts (one string and two integers)
      Parameters:
      p_inputArray - the input string
      Returns:
      boolean value to show whether the input format is valid

    • checkValidOrder

      public boolean checkValidOrder(String p_orderType)
      This function is used to check the order type. The order type should be "deploy"
      Parameters:
      p_orderType - the order type
      Returns:
      boolean value to show whether the order type is valid

    • checkValidCountry

      public boolean checkValidCountry(List<Country> p_countries, String p_countryId)
      This function is used to check the country id. The country id should be one of the countries owned by the player
      Parameters:
      p_countries - the list of countries owned by the player
      p_countryId - the country id
      Returns:
      boolean value to show whether the country id is valid

    • checkValidNum

      public boolean checkValidNum(int p_num, int p_army)
      This function is used to check the number of armies. The number of armies should be less than the number of leftover armies
      Parameters:
      p_num - the number of armies
      p_army - the number of leftover armies
      Returns:
      boolean value to show whether the number of armies is valid
